name: crinkle
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to become covered in many small lines and folds, or to cause something to do this: She crinkled (up) her nose in distaste.

Related words
crinkled
crinkly
a small line or fold: She felt him relax again, the crinkles deepening as his smile returned. It's much easier to sew without wrinkles and crinkles.
Katsumi Murouchi/Moment/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesNatural crinkles make the fabric cling-free and cool.She has characteristic crinkles around the eyes when she smiles.If people were proud of their lines, crinkles, and wrinkles, then maybe things would be different.

to have or cause to have many little lines and folds: [ I ] The paper was old and crinkled. crinkle noun [ C ] us
